Title: Production Planning Senior Staff
Location: Phu Tho Factory, BIDV Tower - Hanoi; Factory in Vinh Phuc; Commercial Office in HCMC
Job Description:
Position Purpose:
The Production Planning Senior Staff is responsible for coordinating and optimizing production planning, materials planning, and capacity management to ensure efficient manufacturing operations within Piaggio Vietnam. The role supports the Head of Operation and collaborates closely with Controlling, Purchasing, Logistics, Warehouse, T&M, and Quality to deliver accurate planning data and ensure smooth and timely production.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Production Planning & Scheduling
- Develop and maintain detailed daily/weekly/monthly production plans based on sales forecasts, inventory targets, and capacity constraints.
- Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure feasibility of production schedules.
- Track plan adherence, identify deviations, and propose corrective actions.
Material Planning & Inventory Control
- Collaborate with Purchasing and Warehouse teams to ensure material availability according to production needs.
- Monitor inventory levels and initiate replenishment actions to prevent shortages or excess stock.
- Support BOM accuracy checks and coordinate updates with other functions.

Capacity & Process Optimization
- Analyze production capacity, manpower availability, and equipment load to optimize resource utilization.
- Participate in continuous improvement activities within the Operations.
- Provide data analysis to support decision-making on layout changes, line balancing, or productivity improvements.

Data Management & Reporting
- Build and maintain advanced Excel databases and planning dashboards.
- Prepare regular reports on production performance, inventory status, capacity utilization, and planning KPIs.
- Support digitalization initiatives within Operations Planning.

Cross-functional Coordination
- Work closely with Operations, Purchasing, Logistics, Quality, controlling to solve planning-related issues.
- Participate in cross-departmental meetings and provide accurate planning-related data and recommendations.
Job Requirements: Mức độ phù hợp và xếp hạng của bạn so với ứng viên khác như thế nào?

Skills: Analytical Skills, Material Planning, MS Excel, Problem-solving, Production Planning

Title: Trade Admin - Oilseeds (Contractor)
Location: ADM Vietnam Le Loi Boulevard, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Supporting the commercial team on daily activities related to trade administration (for e.g. issue trade confirmation, system input, sending contracts to customers, etc)
- Assist with creating contracts against trade entries
- Post-trade negotiation of contractual terms with customers, traders and trade execution teams
- Ensure compliance with contract management policy and all relevant in-house policies and processes
- Follow up on return of countersigned contracts
- Maintain a complete and accurate contract file
- Execution of shipments. This requires careful monitoring of logistics as well as interpretation of contract terms to fulfill customer requirements and timely appropriations against sales
- Identify and interpret market trends, including supply/demand, import and export data and competitor analyses, assist to compile & analyze import/export data & statistics

Title: Office and Trade Admin (Contractor)
Location: ADM Vietnam Le Loi Boulevard, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
Team & Office Operations
• Act as the main point of contact for office-related needs, ensuring a well-organized and efficient workspace.
• Support cross-functional collaboration by fostering communication and alignment between departments.
• Organize paper based and digital data retention function in line with company policy and local regulations.

Communication & Coordination
• Serve as the go-to person for internal communications, ensuring important messages reach the right teams effectively.
• Facilitate meetings, coordinate schedules, and streamline processes to enhance productivity.
• Provide clear and timely updates to leadership on office operations, challenges, and improvements.

Service & Support
• Deliver a high level of service by proactively addressing employee concerns and office logistics.
• Supporting HR function with foreign employee contract and logistical arrangements.
• Organize business travel, company events, meetings, and team-building activities to promote a connected workplace culture.
• Support the commercial team on daily activities related to trade administration (for e.g. issue trade confirmation, system input, sending contracts to customers, collect countersigned contracts, post-trade negotiation of contractual terms with customers, traders and trade execution teams)

Prioritization & Problem-Solving
• Efficiently balance urgent requests with long-term initiatives, ensuring critical tasks receive appropriate attention.
• Identify and implement process improvements to optimize office operations.
• Maintain confidentiality and discretion while managing sensitive company information.

Title: Manager Execution & LOGISTICS
Location: ADM Vietnam Le Loi Boulevard, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
Your Responsibilities
The role will lead ADM Vietnam’s execution and logistics operations for bulk, truck, and container programs. The role ensures smooth, timely, and compliant execution of all trade activities in line with Vietnam’s regulations and ADM’s internal policies. You will work closely with the Singapore execution and trading teams to deliver efficient trade execution and logistics performance.

Execution & Logistics
• Oversee all Vietnam execution and logistics operations for bulk vessels, trucks, and containers.
• Coordinate with ports, warehouses, and supervisors to ensure efficient loading, unloading, and delivery.
• Manage vessel operations, laytime, and communication with agents.
• Support the General and Commercial Managers with cost models and operational planning.
• Contribute to vertical integration initiatives within Vietnam operations.
Planning & Contract Management
• Manage contracts and ensure all sales terms are accurate and compliant.
• Monitor inventory and align with trade teams to ensure adequate quantity and quality.
• Maintain ADM inventory policies and accurate month-end reconciliations.
• Handle import documentation and reporting requirements.
• Understand GAFTA trade rules, INCOTERMS 2020, and freight differentials.
Leadership & Systems
• Lead a team of nine execution coordinators and warehouse supervisors.
• Foster learning and development within the team.
• Maintain and enhance ADM systems (GOS, Covantis) and support new system integrations.
Compliance & Cross-Functional Support
• Ensure compliance with all import/export regulations and maintain relevant licenses.
• Collaborate with trading, distribution, and administration teams to optimize product flow and market opportunities.
• Participate in trade-related learning programs (e.g., GAFTA DLP).
Special Projects
• Collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure successful execution.
• Support digital process improvements and other special projects as directed.
• Work both independently and collaboratively to achieve business goals.
